thread.title: Anthony Taylor to referee Liverpool vs Everton to increase prospect of cards in Merseyside derby
thread.title_full: Anthony Taylor to referee Liverpool vs Everton to increase prospect of cards in Merseyside derby

author: irishmirror
title: Anthony Taylor to referee Liverpool vs Everton to increase prospect of cards in Merseyside derby
text:
Sport Anthony Taylor to referee Liverpool vs Everton to increase prospect of cards in Merseyside derby The Premier League fixture has historically seen more cards than any other and Taylor leads the league in cards shown Share Referee Anthony Taylor clashes with Jurgen Klopp (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get daily   Could   
Anthony Taylor will referee Liverpool vs Everton on Saturday, which could concern Jurgen Klopp. 
The Premier League official has clashed with the Reds boss previously and his appointment heightens the prospect of plenty of cards being shown. 
The Merseyside derby has produced more red and yellow cards than any other and will be officiated by the referee who has produced the most cards in the league this season, report the Liverpool Echo. 
Taylor has shown 132 yellow cards and four red cards in his 32 matches in 2016/17, including seven yellows and a red in his last Premier League outing when Chelsea won at Stoke. Taylor has been liberal with his use of cards this season (Photo: Dean Mouhtaropoulos) 
The Cheshire official has been a familiar face for both Everton and Liverpool this season. 
Taylor has shown 132 yellow cards and four red cards in his 32 matches in 2016/17, including seven yellows and a red in his last Premier League outing when Chelsea won at Stoke.
